channel.title: [Visual Basic] Rich Text Application V3
channel.description: This is my first [u]official[/u] program I've made in Visual Basic. I've put a lot of time and effort into it. I've had some help handed to me along the way, which is why I added a Credits giving credit to 2 people who have helped me. This program is pretty much a advanced version of Microsoft Notepad... Or you could call it a limited version of Microsoft Wordpad. :P Enjoy! And remember, it's my first official program I've made and released, so don't be too harsh on me. ;) *Edit: Thought I'd add in a picture for proof that this is an actual program and not a virus upon opening the file :rolleyes: [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/4kdabp.jpg[/img]

item.title: [Visual Basic] Rich Text Application V3
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“JaydenD12, post:12, topic:345533”]Everyones first application is a notepad type application, or a web browser.[/quote]Mine was a game… It was pretty cool.
Myn was not a notepad, but it did contain one. My first program was a large one, containing a tabbed notepad, a tabbed web-browser, a encryption tab, a Media player, and a couple other things i forget about. It was all simple, but the hard part was getting the tabs inside of tabs. For some reason it didn’t want to stick.

@TOPIC - Try doing some custom features, like spell-checking or something. Even if it only does a few words, its something.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Check

C:\Users\Your Username\Documents\Visual Studio 2008\Projects\ProjectName\ProjectName\bin\Debug

Give us the fileName.EXECUTEABLE file.

item.title: [Visual Basic] Rich Text Application V3
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

JaydenD12:

Everyones first application is a notepad type application, or a web browser.

My first application in C# was a contact list program where you used a database and stored information like the persons name, phone number, company, email, if they were your client or not, and the last time they called. I have a book called Head First C# and that is the first project. It’s a really good book.

Read full topic

item.title: [Visual Basic] Rich Text Application V3
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:5, topic:345533”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=441914.msg3247470#msg3247470 date=1277492810]
EDIT - I trusted you so I temporarily disabled Norton, and I tried to run it. Thank goodness no real virus. The problem is that when you uploaded your application, you forgot the other files! You need to upload that entire folder that was made when you published it, or else people will get a ‘cannot find runtime’ or something like that.
[/quote]
Oh, that would explain why the Print feature hasn’t been working o.O[/quote]You going to re-upload? I want to see your progress

Read full topic

item.title: [Visual Basic] Rich Text Application V3
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

Davidi2:

EDIT - I trusted you so I temporarily disabled Norton, and I tried to run it. Thank goodness no real virus. The problem is that when you uploaded your application, you forgot the other files! You need to upload that entire folder that was made when you published it, or else people will get a ‘cannot find runtime’ or something like that.

Oh, that would explain why the Print feature hasn’t been working o.O

Read full topic

item.title: [Visual Basic] Rich Text Application V3
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

@Pure2ownage - I agree with #1. Perhaps showing something like the current status of the document, ‘Saving…’ etc would be nice. I don’t agree with #2, but #3 yes. Make a list of the features.

I downloaded it, but Norton is picking up a security risk from it and not letting me run it.

EDIT - I trusted you so I temporarily disabled Norton, and I tried to run it. Thank goodness no real virus. The problem is that when you uploaded your application, you forgot the other files! You need to upload that entire folder that was made when you published it, or else people will get a ‘cannot find runtime’ or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: [Visual Basic] Rich Text Application V3
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Suggestion(s):-

  1. Add a “StatusStrip” Item.
  2. MAYBE Add a “ToolBar” Item.
  3. Show some of the features.
  4. Dont show it unless you have something other than: open, new, print, save, cut, copy, paste ect.

Read full topic

item.title: [Visual Basic] Rich Text Application V3
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

This is my first official program I’ve made in Visual Basic. I’ve put a lot of time and effort into it. I’ve had some help handed to me along the way, which is why I added a Credits giving credit to 2 people who have helped me. This program is pretty much a advanced version of Microsoft Notepad… Or you could call it a limited version of Microsoft Wordpad. Enjoy! And remember, it’s my first official program I’ve made and released, so don’t be too harsh on me.
*Edit: Thought I’d add in a picture for proof that this is an actual program and not a virus upon opening the file :rolleyes:
